Revolving around celestial symbolism, Constellations earned the artist praise from AndrÃ© Breton, who seventeen years later wrote a series of poems, named after and inspired by MirÃ³'s series.[16] Features of this work revealed a shifting focus to the subjects of women, birds, and the moon, which would dominate his iconography for much of the rest of his career.
